title: Long-term exposure to fine particulate matter and diabetes in Bangladeshi adults: Can clean air targets curb the rising diabetes burden?
abstract: Diabetes is a growing public health challenge in Bangladesh, potentially exacerbated by high levels of air pollution. However, no nationally representative epidemiological evidence exists in Bangladesh. We therefore investigated the association between long-term exposure to PM This retrospective study included 13,965 adults (8284 women and 6965 men) who participated in the nationally representative Bangladesh Demographic and Health Survey (BDHS) 2022. The annual average concentrations of PM Each 10 μg/m Our results demonstrate that long-term exposure to PM
